marc:datafield.marc:subfield: 275 x 205 mm. bound to 292 x 215 mm. (with fold-out documents and maps up to 427 x 600 mm.) +
Foliation: Paper, i + 356 + i; printed items have individual signatures and some have pagination; items are numbered in pencil, with later numbers not always corresponding to this record.
Script: Written in cursive script by many hands.
Decoration: 2 engraved maps of the Pontine Marshes (f. 145r, 333r), 1 of Roman aqueducts (f. 184r).
Binding: 18th-century parchment, lacking one pair of ties out of 2, title Paludi Pontine, visita delle strade di Roma and shelf number 142 in ink on spine.
Origin: Written in Italy, mostly in Rome, between 1586 and 1760.
1. f.1r-1v: [18th-century table of contents for groups of documents]
2. f.3r-4v: [Italian manuscript regarding the marshes dated 1586]
3. f.5r-8v: Privilegii che desiderano li bonificatori delle Paludi Pontine.
4. f.9r: Quando la commenda di [?] ad instigatione ...
6. f.13r-14v: Mario Macealli, dottor di leggi, nelle cause della bonificatione delle Paludi Pontine, 1589.
7. f.15r-15v: [Manuscript copy of Latin letter to Flaminio Piatti (Cardinal Platto), after 1591]
8. f.16r-16v: Fabius Ursinus ... in negocio bonificationis paludum Pontinarum, 1587
9. f.18r-19v: [Italian letter to a cardinal concerning Giovanni Battista Garzoni and the reclamation of the marshes, after 1582]
10. f.20r-20v: [Latin official document on parchment with signature and seal of Flaminio Piatti (Cardinal Plato) concerning the reclamation of the marshes, 1604]
11. f.21r-26r: [Accounts and records of the reclamation in Italian]
12. f.28r-92v: Istoria antica, e moderna: stato presente, rimedi, e mezzia disseccar le Paludi Pontine: utile pubblico, e privato a derivarne, [after 1742]

13. f.95r-144v: Memorie dell'antico, e presente stato delle Paludi Pontine: rimedi, mezzi per disseccarle a pubblico, e privato vantaggio; opera / di Emerico Bolognini, governatore generale di marittima, e campagna [printed in Rome: Eredi Barbiellini a Pasquino, 1759]
14. f.145r: Pianta delle Paludi Pontine / ordinata da monsignore illustrissimo e reverendissimo Emerico Bolognini, governatore generale di marittima, e campagna, 1759 [printed foldout map laid in]
15. f.146r-169v: [Unidentified printed work in Italian and Latin against the cutting of the forests of Cisterna and Sermoneta, between the Pontine Marshes and Rome, ca. 1715]
16. f.170r-174v: [Unidentified printed collection of 7 15th-century papal bulls in Latin concerning Cisterna and Sermoneta and 2 edicts in Italian concerning the cutting of forests]
17. f.176r-183v: [2 printed works in Italian, containing reports and accounts concerning the delivery of water to Rome, printed in Rome: Stamperia della Rev. Camera Apostolica, 1695]

18. f.184r: Planta del nuovo aquedotto che conduce l'acqua civita vechia fabricato in parte sopra la ruuine dell'antico construtto da Traiano imperatore / Cintius Florus, Alexander Specchi, [printed foldout map, between 1691 and 1700]

19. f.185r-188r: Bando generale delli signori mastri di strade [printed in Rome: Stamperia della Rev. Camera Apostolica, 1681, with manuscript note, Maestri delle strade consolari, visita, 1681, laid in]
20. f.189v-190v: Obligho di Pietro Antonio Leone, 1682
21. f.191r-196v: Romana taxae viarum: Resolutio [printed in Rome: Typis Reverendae Camerae Apostolicae, 1678]
22. f.197r-199r: Nota dell'augumento fà la tabella de casali [accounts]
23. f.200r-212r: [Street inspection reports, many signed by architects Pietro Andrea Bufalini Tomasso Zanoli], 1686.
24. f.214r-215v: [Letter from the residents of Strada Baccina to the Monsignor Presidente delle Strade, undated]
25. f.216r-217v: [Letter in Latin from Petrus Grossus and Joseph Chiorrius to the Viarum Praesidi, undated]
26. f.218r-219r: [Brief records of meetings held 11 June and 2 July 1686]
27. f.221r-232v: [Undated letter and summarium (accounts, latest date 1686) from Christoforo Cappellone to the Congregatione delle Strade]
28. f.233r: Editto che si nettano le case, cantine, e strade dall'acque, & immonditie del fiume [printed edict from Pietro Millini, Maestro di Strade, and others], 1686.
29. f.234r: [Manuscript document concerning the Maestri di Strade, undated]
30. f.236r-236v: [Manuscript report concerning walls, signed by Pietro Millini, Maestro di Strade], 1686.
31. f.238r-239v: Romana taxa extra Portam S. Ioannis in Laterano / Congregatione Viarum, 1684.
32. f.240r-241v: [Letter from Onofrio Colorossi to Pietro Mollini, Maestro delle Strade, undated]
33. f.242r-245v: Capitoli sopra lo spurgo della citta di Roma [undated]
34. f.246r-253v: Capitoli sopra l'appalto delle strade dentro Roma [undated]
35. f.254r-263r: [Street inspection reports, later ones signed by architects Pietro Andrea Bufalini and Tomasso Zanoli], 1683, 1686.
36. f.265r-266v: [Letter from the padroni delle vigne di Roma (owners of vineyards) to Pietro Mellini, Maestro di Strade, internal date of 1684]
37. f.267r-306v: [Street inspection reports, some addressed to Pietro Millini and some signed by architects Pietro Andrea Bufalini and Tomasso Zanoli], 1685-1686.

38. f.307r: [Title page for Secondo ragionamento / di Monsignor Propspero Lambertini, avvocato concistoriale, nel quale oltre alcune nuove ragioni s'espongono all Sacra Congregationae deputata le repliche alla risposta del Sig. Gioseppe Cappuccini sopra il taglio delle Macchie di Sermoneta, e Cisterna, printed in 1715; possibly the title page for Item 15]

39. f.308r-332v: Risposta al ragionamento di Monsignor Lambertini sopra il taglio delle macchie di Sermoneta, e Cisterna / Giuseppe Cappucini [printed in Palestrina: Stamperia Barberina per Gio. Domenico Masci, 1715]
40. f.333r: [Printed map showing the Paludi Pontine / Giovanni Maria Lancisi, 1717]
41. f.334r-352r: [4 printed Italian texts on Sermoneta and Cisterna], 1714-1715
42. f.353r-356v: Memoriale [printed report in Italian concerning Sermoneta and Cisterna], 1714.
Described in Transformation of knowledge: early manuscripts from the collection of Lawrence J. Schoenberg (London: Paul Holberton, 2006),

Large, mid-18th-century compilation of records on 2 subjects: first, manuscript and printed texts on the reclamation (bonificazione) of the Pontine Marshes (Paludi Pontine) and the cutting of the forests of Sermoneta and Cisterna di Latina, and second, mostly manuscript records of the Maestri delle Strade or Congregazione delle Strade, the municipal body in charge of the streets of Rome, and particularly of Pietro Millini, one of the Maestri delle Strade. The materials on the Pontine Marshes range from 16th-century manuscripts (f. 3r-19v), to 3 engraved maps from the late 17th and 18th centuries (f. 145r, 184r, 333r), to substantial printed texts from the 18th century. 2 texts printed ca. 1715, which present arguments about the cutting of the forests of Sermoneta and Cisterna di Latina, have parchment finding tabs (f. 146r, 307r) that correspond to a partial table of contents at the beginning of the volume (f. 1r-1v), which notes that the 2 items are related. The records of the Maestri delle Strade are a group of late 17th-century manuscripts in the middle of the volume (f. 185r-306v) including correspondence, reports of street inspections (many signed by the architects Pietro Andrea Bufalini and Tomasso Zanoli), and a single printed edict (f. 233r).
Several component items formerly owned by Pietro Millini; the volume formerly in the archives of the Millini, a noble family of Rome (Kraus), and in the Colonna Biblioteca (Phillipps).
Formerly owned by Frederick North, Earl of Guilford; sold at auction at Messrs. Evans (London) as part of his collection, 8 Dec. 1830, lot 289, vol. 16, to bookseller Thomas Thorpe.
Sold by Thorpe to Sir Thomas Phillipps, ms. 7636 (label on spine).
Sold as part of the residue of the Phillipps collection first to William H. Robinson Ltd., 1945, and again to Hans Peter Kraus, Mar. 1978.
Sold by Hans Peter Kraus, List 204 (1982), no. 74, to John D. Stanitz (Cleveland, Ohio), Ms. 8.
Acquired by Lawrence J. Schoenberg with other Stanitz manuscripts, Sept. 1997.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.
Lawrence J. Schoenberg & Barbara Brizdle Manuscript Initiative.
